page.title: 02Elford Church
page.content: Our Church was built in the 12th century, Norman.The large arch inside was Norman,dividing the Nave from the South Aisle until it was restored in 1848.Sir Thomas Arderne companion in arms of Edward the Black Prince,resored and enlarged the Church in the style of that period.A century after Sir John Stanley made the South and also the Chantry Chapel dedicated to the Virgin Mary.The roses and portcullises on the South Aisle windows are supposed to mark the relationship of Stanley with Kig Henry the 7th who was believed to have had a secret meeting with Stanley the night before the Battle of Bosworth persuading him to turn from Richard the 3rd.That is how we have our Church today.
